title: Add visible sectors and products to store floor

requirements.text: Display all 17 store sectors (Produce, Butcher, Fish, Bakery, Dairy, Frozen, Beverages, Snacks, Canned, Cleaning, Personal Care, Baby, Pet, Electronics, Clothing, Home, Pharmacy) as visible elements on the store floor canvas with their icons and names

quotes: Se vc fala q isto é um jogo completando supermercado então pode fazer uma atualização no seu banco de dados

acceptanceCriteria: Each sector appears as a labeled area on the store floor grid
Sector icons from sectorConstants.ts are rendered for each department
Sectors are positioned logically within the store layout

requirements.text: Render products within their assigned sectors on the store floor, showing product names and stock levels from the initialProducts.ts data

quotes: Se vc fala q isto é um jogo completando supermercado então pode fazer uma atualização no seu banco de dados

acceptanceCriteria: Products from initialProducts.ts appear within their corresponding sector areas
Product names are visible on shelves or display areas
Stock levels or quantity indicators are shown for each product
Products are distributed across all 24 items and 17 sectors as defined in initialProducts.ts

requirements.text: Make the store floor interactive, allowing users to tap/click on sectors to view detailed information (quality, stock value, staff, cleanliness) similar to the SectorsPanel component
acceptanceCriteria: Tapping a sector on the canvas opens a detail view or overlay
Sector details display quality, stock, value, staff, and cleanliness metrics
Mobile-optimized touch targets (minimum 44px) for sector selection
Visual feedback when selecting a sector

requirements.text: Add visual representation of shelves, aisles, and product displays within the store floor grid to create a realistic supermarket layout
acceptanceCriteria: Shelving units are drawn within sector areas
Aisles between sectors are clearly visible for customer movement
Product displays (refrigerators, freezers, bakery cases) are rendered appropriately for each sector type
Visual distinction between different types of display fixtures

constraints: Do not modify the existing customer simulation or animation logic in useGameSimulation.ts
Maintain the current GameCanvas rendering architecture using canvas 2D context
Keep the existing sector metadata definitions in sectorConstants.ts unchanged
Preserve the 24 products defined in initialProducts.ts without modification
nonGoals: Changing the backend data structure or API endpoints
Modifying the authentication or profile setup flow
Adding new game mechanics or simulation features
